De Oratore was first printed at Subiaco about 1465, (in fact it was the very first book printed in Italy) and three other Italian editions followed in fifteen years.

All subsequent editions have been supplanted by that of A. S. Wilkins, Oxford, 1892, the earliest con- taining a commentary in English. Its introduction is a mine of information on the text and contents of the book and the earlier history of rhetoric in Greeee and Rome.
